sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a base that measures 10 cm by 15 cm, and a height of 20 cm. What is the volume of the pyramid?
message_2:
To find the volume of a rectangular pyramid, we can use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × Base Area × Height

The base area of the rectangular pyramid is given by the product of its length and width:

Base Area = Length × Width = 10 cm × 15 cm = 150 cm²

Now, we can plug the base area and height into the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × 150 cm² × 20 cm = (1/3) × 3000 cm³ = 1000 cm³

So, the volume of the rectangular pyramid is 1000 cubic centimeters.
